docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New- York Daily Times: We see from the telegraphic reports from Washington, that 4" Commodore MERVIN has been ordered to the Navy-Yard at California, in place of Commodore MCKEEVER, declined."
docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New- York Daily Times: We see from the telegraphic reports from Washington, that 4" Commodore MERVIN has been ordered to the Navy-Yard at California, in place of Commodore MCKEEVER, declined."

docs.lead_paragraph: The managers of the Washington National Monument have issued an appeal to the nation for aid, saying that the funds are now nearly exhausted, and that, unless prompt and zealous efforts be made to raise money, the work must be discontinued. The monument is intended to reach a height of 517 1/2 feet, and it has already been erected to an altitude of 154 feet, at a cost of $210,000.

docs.lead_paragraph: WEEKLY REPORT OF DEATHS IN BROOKLYN. The Health Officer reports 79 deaths for the week ending Saturday last--Males, 51; Females, 28; Adults, 44; Children, 35; of the whole number there were 14 deaths by cholera; 8 by cholera infantum; 4 by cholera morbus; diarrhoca 3, and dysentery 2; 5 by consumption, and 6 drowned. There were but five cases of fevers.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; Defences of the Port and Island--Railroads in Old Spain--Troops from Cadiz, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: It has been determined to reconstruct and extend the exterior defences of Havana on its western and most exposed front, so that the old walls will be of very little use, and probably will be demolished after the new line is in working order.
docs.snippet: It has been determined to reconstruct and extend the exterior defences of Havana on its western and most exposed front, so that the old walls will be of very little use, and probably will be demolished after the new line is in working order.

headline.main: LONG-ISLAND.; BROOKLYN CITY TRACT SOCIETY.. MAYHEM. VIOLATING THE SUNDAY ORDINANCE. PERJURY. FATAL ACCIDENT. THE ROBBERY OF A POLICEMAN. THE GRAND JURY. MAYOR'S COURT, WILLIAMSBURG. POLICE COURT.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE ( CHOLERA.--Five cases of Cholera were reported to the Board of Health on Saturday; two resulted in death. It is proper to state that one of the persons who died, was brought from New-York in a dying state, and the other died at the Hospital, but was not conveyed there until all prospect or relief was hopeless. .
